sections.heading: Present Tense Overview
sections.content:
Present tense adjectives describe current states , general truths , and characteristics . Both i-adjectives and na-adjectives have present forms.

I-adjective: 高い - is expensive Na-adjective: 静かだ - is quiet

children.heading: Plain Form
children.content:
Dictionary form = Present tense

高い - is expensive 大きい - is big 美味しい - is delicious 難しい - is difficult

children.heading: Polite Form
children.content:
Add です

高いです - is expensive (polite) 大きいです - is big (polite) 美味しいです - is delicious (polite) 難しいです - is difficult (polite)

children.heading: Plain Form
children.content:
Na-adjective + だ

静かだ - is quiet 便利だ - is convenient きれいだ - is beautiful 元気だ - is energetic

children.heading: Polite Form
children.content:
Na-adjective + です

静かです - is quiet (polite) 便利です - is convenient (polite) きれいです - is beautiful (polite) 元気です - is energetic (polite)

children.heading: 1. Current State
children.content: 今日は暑い "Today is hot" この部屋は静かです "This room is quiet" 私は元気だ "I am healthy/fine"

children.heading: 2. General Truth
children.content: 富士山は高い "Mt. Fuji is tall" この町は便利です "This town is convenient" 日本語は難しい "Japanese is difficult"

children.heading: 3. Permanent Characteristics
children.content: 彼は背が高い "He is tall" この車は速いです "This car is fast" 彼女はきれいだ "She is beautiful"

children.heading: 4. Habitual States
children.content: 私は毎日忙しい "I am busy every day" この店はいつも静かです "This store is always quiet"

sections.heading: Comparison: I-adj vs Na-adj Present
sections.content: | Type | Plain | Polite | Example | | ------ | ----- | ------ | ----------------- | | I-adj | い | いです | 高い / 高いです | | Na-adj | だ | です | 静かだ / 静かです |

children.heading: Side by Side
children.content: I-adjective: この本は高い "This book is expensive" この本は高いです "This book is expensive" (polite) Na-adjective: この部屋は静かだ "This room is quiet" この部屋は静かです "This room is quiet" (polite)

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content:
Modify directly:

高い本 - expensive book 大きい家 - big house 美味しい料理 - delicious food 新しい車 - new car

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content:
Add な:

静かな部屋 - quiet room 便利な店 - convenient store きれいな花 - beautiful flower 元気な子供 - energetic child

children.heading: Describing Objects
children.content: この車は高い "This car is expensive" そのカバンは大きいです "That bag is big" あの建物はきれいだ "That building is beautiful"

children.heading: Describing Places
children.content: 東京は大きい "Tokyo is big" この町は静かです "This town is quiet" あの場所は便利だ "That place is convenient"

children.heading: Describing People
children.content: 彼は親切だ "He is kind" 先生は優しいです "The teacher is gentle" 田中さんは元気です "Tanaka is energetic"

children.heading: Describing Weather
children.content: 今日は暑い "Today is hot" 外は寒いです "Outside is cold" 天気がいい "The weather is good"

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content: 高いですか？ "Is it expensive?" 美味しいですか？ "Is it delicious?" 難しいですか？ "Is it difficult?"

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content: 静かですか？ "Is it quiet?" 便利ですか？ "Is it convenient?" 元気ですか？ "Are you well?"

children.heading: Affirmative
children.content: Q: 高いですか？ "Is it expensive?" A: はい、高いです "Yes, it is expensive" Q: 静かですか？ "Is it quiet?" A: はい、静かです "Yes, it is quiet"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: Q: 難しいですか？ "Is it difficult?" A: いいえ、難しくないです "No, it is not difficult" Q: 便利ですか？ "Is it convenient?" A: いいえ、便利じゃないです "No, it is not convenient"

children.heading: Example 1: Shopping
children.content: A: このシャツはどうですか？ "How is this shirt?" B: いいですね。でも高いです "It's good. But it's expensive" A: 本当ですね。あれは？ "That's true. How about that one?" B: あれは安くていいです "That one is cheap and good"

children.heading: Example 2: Describing a Place
children.content: A: この町はどうですか？ "How is this town?" B: とても静かです "It's very quiet" A: 便利ですか？ "Is it convenient?" B: はい、駅も近くて便利です "Yes, the station is also close and it's convenient"

children.heading: Example 3: Asking About Food
children.content: A: この店の料理は美味しいですか？ "Is the food at this restaurant delicious?" B: はい、とても美味しいです "Yes, it's very delicious" A: 高くないですか？ "Isn't it expensive?" B: 少し高いですが、美味しいです "It's a little expensive, but it's delicious"

children.heading: Connecting with て-form
children.content: この部屋は広くて明るい "This room is spacious and bright" 彼女はきれいで親切です "She is beautiful and kind" この本は面白くて安い "This book is interesting and cheap"

children.heading: Intensifiers
children.content: とても高い "very expensive" すごく大きい "extremely big" 本当に美味しい "really delicious" かなり難しい "quite difficult" ちょっと高い "a little expensive"

children.heading: Reducing Intensity
children.content: あまり高くない "not very expensive" それほど大きくない "not that big" 全然難しくない "not difficult at all"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Wrong Polite Form
children.content: Wrong: 高いはです ❌ Right: 高いです ✓ Wrong: 静かなです ❌ Right: 静かです ✓

children.heading: Mistake 2: Mixing I-adj and Na-adj Patterns
children.content: Wrong: 高いだ ❌ Right: 高い ✓ (i-adjective doesn't need だ) Wrong: 静か ❌ (as predicate) Right: 静かだ ✓ (na-adjective needs だ)

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using だ in Polite Speech
children.content: Wrong: 高いだです ❌ Right: 高いです ✓ Wrong: 静かだです ❌ Right: 静かです ✓

sections.heading: Present Tense vs Other Tenses
sections.content: | Tense | I-adjective | Na-adjective | Meaning | | -------- | ----------- | ------------ | ------------------------------- | | Present | 高い | 静かだ | is expensive / is quiet | | Past | 高かった | 静かだった | was expensive / was quiet | | Negative | 高くない | 静かじゃない | is not expensive / is not quiet |

children.heading: Plain (Casual)
children.content:
高い - expensive 大きい - big 静かだ - quiet 便利だ - convenient

Use with: friends, family, casual situations

children.heading: Polite (Formal)
children.content:
高いです - expensive 大きいです - big 静かです - quiet 便利です - convenient

Use with: strangers, superiors, formal situations

children.heading: Describing Items
children.content: この車は速い "This car is fast" その時計は高いです "That watch is expensive" あのカバンは軽い "That bag is light"

children.heading: Describing States
children.content: 私は今忙しい "I am busy now" 彼は元気です "He is well" この問題は簡単だ "This problem is simple"

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ I-adjectives: dictionary form = present ✓ Na-adjectives: need だ (plain) or です (polite) ✓ Add です for politeness to i-adjectives ✓ Use for current states and general truths ✓ Modify nouns directly (i-adj) or with な (na-adj) ✓ Can combine multiple adjectives ✓ Questions add か ✓ Present describes now and always

Master present tense - most common adjective form!
